rename.from: rclone sync server side copy on google files (google sheets/docs) does not have the correct modtime time
rename.to: drive: Server side copy for sheets/docs does not set the correct modtime

body:
It appears that server side copies of docs are losing their modtime.

I tried putting in a work-around to set the modtime after the file was copied, but this didn't work unless I put a 1 second delay in!

All of which are pointing at some kind of bug in google drive.

Try this work-around and see how it works for you

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

> Try this work-around and see how it works for you
> 
> https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I used the beta windows 64 version and I ran the same command (except I think I used a different destination remote) and the same thing occurred for me. I used a test folder and **1 google sheets**. 

Here is the logs

```
C:\beta>rclone sync "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" -vv --drive-server-side-across-configs
2020/08/18 15:22:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]
2020/08/18 15:22:27 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Qiang\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"

Elapsed time:        13.4s

2020/08/18 15:22:49 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]
2020/08/18 15:22:49 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Qiang\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/08/18 15:22:52 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for checks to finish
2020/08/18 15:22:52 DEBUG : Test File.xlsx: Modification times differ by 2h31m53.469s: 2020-08-18 16:50:44.735 +0000 UTC, 2020-08-18 19:22:38.204 +0000 UTC
2020/08/18 15:22:52 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for transfers to finish

Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%

Elapsed time:         9.4s

2020/08/18 15:22:59 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

I ran it again except this time I put 2 google files in the folder. 1 google doc and 1 google sheets. 
Oddly, it duplicated the google doc, but not the google sheets. In the earlier test when I had just 1 google sheets in the test folder, it was duplicating the google sheets. 

New run with 1 google doc and 1 google sheets: 
```
C:\beta>rclone sync "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" -vv --drive-server-side-across-configs
2020/08/18 17:18:24 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]

```

> I used the beta windows 64 version and I ran the same command (except I think I used a different destination remote) and the same thing occurred for me. I used a test folder and 1 google sheets.

There is definitely something odd going on. I tried to recreate the duplication of the google sheets from prior, but it no longer duplicates the google sheets anymore. Even when I removed the google docs and put in the same google sheets it no longer duplicates the google sheets. 

```C:\beta>rclone sync "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" -vv --drive-server-side-across-configs
2020/08/18 17:33:02 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]
2020/08/18 17:33:02 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Qiang\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/08/18 17:33:04 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for checks to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:04 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for transfers to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:10 INFO  : Test File.xlsx: Copied (server side copy)
2020/08/18 17:33:10 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:10 INFO  :
Transferred:           off / off, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         8.5s

2020/08/18 17:33:10 DEBUG : 6 go routines active

C:\beta>rclone sync "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" -vv --drive-server-side-across-configs
2020/08/18 17:33:11 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-310-g54f46abc-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]
2020/08/18 17:33:11 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Qiang\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for checks to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : Test File.xlsx: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0s, within tolerance 1ms)
2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : Test File.xlsx: Unchanged skipping
2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : Google drive root 'Test Folder': Waiting for transfers to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2020/08/18 17:33:13 INFO  : There was nothing to transfer
2020/08/18 17:33:13 INFO  :
Transferred:             0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         1.9s

2020/08/18 17:33:13 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```
So basically, sometimes it works correctly and sometimes it duplicates.

I've just realised there are two parts to this bug

1. not setting the modtime correctly
2. creating duplicates

I've tried to address 1. and it sounds like that is working some of the time - is that correct?

I haven't addressed 2. though - I think that is a function of the actual server side copy. When rclone decides it needs to copy the doc, it does the copy but doesn't delete the old copy of the doc.

I've fixed that and increased the timeout before setting the modtime which should help with 1 - can you give it a go?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.3-311-g1b5ca0c8-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Oops, messed that one up, try this

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.3-311-g01bfea33-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

> Oops, messed that one up, try this
> 
> https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.3-311-g01bfea33-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I ran a few tests through this one and it didn't duplicate google docs or google sheets. So I think the problem is solved. Thanks a lot!

```C:\beta>rclone sync "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" -vv --drive-server-side-across-configs
2020/08/19 08:37:32 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3-311-g01bfea33-fix-4517-drive-doc-modtime-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "Academic Resources:Test Folder" "Academic Resources Backup:Test Folder" "-vv" "--drive-server-side-across-configs"]
```

Thanks for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.53
I still seem to be encountering this issue on my Mac using 1.53.2. I am using `--drive-server-side-across-configs=true`. Could that be contributing to this bug?

Just noticed that the OP was also using across-configs. Maybe because I am transferring from a My Drive to a Shared Drive? I do see the `"Sleeping for 2s before setting the modtime to work around drive bug - see #4517"` in the logs.

> Just noticed that the OP was also using across-configs. Maybe because I am transferring from a My Drive to a Shared Drive? I do see the `"Sleeping for 2s before setting the modtime to work around drive bug - see #4517"` in the logs.

Drive to shared drive could be the problem, I'm not sure. Maybe rclone needs to wait longer in that case. You could try changing the code to see if that helps?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/45e8bea8d099db946faa2af7342f8152c5c12f96/backend/drive/drive.go#L2356-L2361
